details.notes: Born in the Capital to Kellen Dray, logician at the Capital Philosophical Society

notes: Birth of Lorren Dray. Her father Kellen Dray was known for contesting Vance's weighted passages.
Dray begins formal training at the Capital Archives at age 20. Exposed to the practical problems of document organization.

details.description: Dray observes that documents cannot be uniquely classified - the same document appears different depending on the method of access

notes: Key observation: a document's 'identity' depends on how you probe it. Echo of Vold's Probing Theorem.
First manuscript documenting the problem of multiple classifications.
Promoted after demonstrating organizational insight.

details.description: The Archive itself has categorical structure - access methods are objects, document flows are morphisms

notes: Key insight: the Archive is a category. This reframes archival science categorically.

details.claim: A document is a functor from the Archive category to Sets - it assigns to each access method a set of observations

notes: Dray proposes that documents are functors. This is the presheaf interpretation of archives.

details.title: On the Categorical Structure of Archives

notes: First major treatise establishing the archive-as-category framework.

details.objection: Functors require strict preservation of composition - archive access is too chaotic for this

notes: Vornis Keth, known for his resonance calculus work, contests the strict functoriality assumption.
Response to Keth's objection. Demonstrates that archive operations satisfy functoriality conditions.

details.description: Special functors Hom(A, -) represent the viewpoint from a single access method - these determine all other observations

notes: Discovery of representable functors in archival context. Prefigures the Yoneda embedding.
Promoted to Senior Archivist in recognition of her theoretical contributions.
Major treatise on representable functors. Shows how Hom-functors capture all observation structure.
Death of Tessery Vold at age 82. Dray writes memorial noting Vold's influence on her work.
Published exchange between Dray and Vance on how their frameworks relate. Dray shows weighted passages are enriched functors.

details.description: Document embeddings are the numerical values that functors assign - each dimension corresponds to a probe

notes: Key insight connecting document functors to embeddings. Each embedding dimension is a functor value.
Treatise establishing the connection between functor values and numerical representations.
Appointed Director of Classification at the Capital Archives.

details.title: On the Unity of Archive Structure

notes: Dray's synthesis work unifying document functors with weighted passages and classical archival methods.
Death of Merrit Vance. Dray delivers eulogy at Western Archive memorial.
Dray's definitive work. Establishes the complete document functor framework as taught in modern archives.
Dray retires after 47 years at the Capital Archives.

details.epitaph: She showed us what documents truly are

notes: Death of Lorren Dray at age 72. Buried in the Capital, near her father's grave.
